title: If people didnt complain about EVERY change before getting used to it...
body:
Riot would probably listen more.
Its like the boy who cried wolf, with every change the boards explode and then a month later everyones cool with the change. Maybe if people actually gave things a chance rather than complaining the DAY it hits live, our ACTUAL complaints would be more valid.

If it was a group, either no one would have said anything or one of the other members of the group would have told you that it was a Yasuo top. If you think this is what chat with a 4-man group looks like you have obviously never encountered one.

I actually have. I've run into them regularly in norms and already twice in ranked. It's the exact same way.

The reason you experience that at all in solo-queue is because you're in lower ranks where miscommunication - or utter lack of it - is fucking notorious. And you can say I'm bronze shaming - I'm really not, unless bronze shaming includes pointing out empirical fact about the rank in general. In which case, sure, why not.

In fact, the only time I've witnessed an utter lack of in-game communication from more than a single person - and mind you the single person not talking only happens once in a while at night when the non-NA people get on - is in a pre-made team where they're too busy talking to each other to give the others in the game the time of day.  And this happens _regularly_. It's why duos are so hated - they're so biased for each other and basically only rely on each other that they practically sever themselves from the rest of the team.  Unless you're gathering up a full team of 5 every game, you're going to be left out of the loop in all of these cases.

Face it, this has only offered a small reprise from ranked's issues while introducing a whole slew of new ones.  The good is outweighed heavily by the bad.

The problem does not really lay with the change, the problem is they took a great tool out that a lot of people used, for good reasons.  The change is great for those who want to play ranked games etc.... Solo was way better than having to type in top first, or bot, and still have others disregard who was first in claiming, or quitting as they did not get there first.  More wasted time.  Solo que was worth any wait I ever encountered.  Why take out a perfectly operational tool?  Make the change, but keep what was working too.

While for some things this applies, this kind of queue actually isn't new - I've already dealt with it myself.  It's basically ripped directly off of Heroes of the Storm.

When I first got to ranked in that game and saw that solo-queue was for 1-4 man queues, I was like, "Wait, what?" Yeah, in that one at least if you had a full 5 you were made to go into team queue.  Anyhow, you think, "Wow, that's great! I'm not much for having to deal with randoms, and this way I don't have to choose between a bunch of my friends!"

Well, issue number 1 immediately is that as you get into higher MMR's, you see way more teams.  This means to have a great chance at doing much, you need to have the same organization - IE, gotta have a team as well.  So if you're never climbing, you're probably having a jolly time and are free to go about playing when and where you want.

This gets to not be the case in higher MMR's. It may not even be more teams but more that a higher percentage of players are playing in teams - this basically restricts what times you can go into solo-queue if you don't have people to play with.  This also means if you're not on at good hours of the day, then you're probably not going to have a consistent team, either.  If you don't have a consistent team, you can't climb higher. You will basically be stunted solely by the fact that you do not have the same access to resources other players do - don't have a diamond 1 friend on at the same time as you? Well, sucks to be you.

It's something that sounds great on paper but in practice is just lousy and even more restricting than ever.  You're stuck to either fall or not climb, or you're given strict time-frames when you and your mates can all be on to queue up.  And that's granting that you have a full set of 5 people to join you.

You would have a valid point, but the pure fact of the matter is that many, MANY times, Riot is just WRONG and we're forced to just deal with it. 

It doesn't make it any LESS of a stupid/bad decision just because a month later people grudgingly accept that Riot has literally no interest in the opinions and feelings of their playerbase now that they're a big company.

Sure the people going full rage-train could act better, but they're reacting to stupid decisions that should have been very obvious as stupid decisions, and Riot is refusing to listen because they're ***convinced*** they're the smartest motherfuckers on the planet and their players are somehow "below" them.

Assuming that you're referring to the Dynamic Queue and New Champ Select changes, the fact is that there was just some plain undeniably (at least by rational people) bad choices made with either how things are designed or how they're handled. If a month later, people are tired of of trying to reach Riot's ear, that doesn't make those decisions any LESS of bad decisions, it just means people gave up on Riot, as is frequently the case because Riot doesn't care. Not really. Not in a way that means they have real respect for the people who've supported them for years.

Riot is not EA or anything like that, I'm not saying that. I'm just saying A) People react so powerfully because Riot ***is*** wrong a ***lot*** and they're just ***wayyyyyyyy*** too arrogant or comfortable to accept that fact any more and B) People don't "like" the changes a month later, they just remember Riot won't give a shit no matter ***how*** much they complain because Riot is ***never*** willing to legitimately accept that they fucked up.

Riot ***did*** listen, once upon a time. Then they became a global phenomenon and forget their fucking roots. They don't think they need their players any more and don't respect them as long as those players keep buying skins.
Eventually they'll stop being the top of the dogpile in their genre. I would be willing to bet they'll change their approach to their community pretty quick then. Or they'll fade into obscurity. That's how arrogance works.

First of all, the new champ select is perfectly fine. The only people complaining are one-trick ponies who can't be bothered to learn how to play two different roles.

To say that players complain because riot is wrong is such a biased statement that I'm not even sure if you're trolling or not. 

Literally all of the complaints I've seen have been the most idiotic ever. "Can we get more than 3 refunds?" (Just used them wisely, and be happy you got any because most companies don't give you ANY). "*insert generic complaint about a TINY buff to any AIDS character (riven/Teemo/Munro/Heim)*." 

People complained about the god forsaken color coded team usernames in the post-game screen (that were perfectly fine, although buggy. but the complaints were that they were there at all, not for bugs). 

If the player base had any legitimate complaints, maybe I would agree with you more. 

Riot can't exactly be wrong about anything. It's their game and if they want Darius ADC and tank Soraka, they can and will make it happen. It doesn't make them wrong for doing so, it means they're changing dynamics of the game (which is perfectly fine to do and neither wrong nor right). They can implement whatever they want.
